tasks.task: Operating a combine harvester during wheat harvesting
subtasks: Starting the combine harvester and conducting pre-harvest checks
Guiding the combine through the wheat field, adjusting direction as needed
Monitoring the combine's performance, making adjustments for optimal efficiency
Handling clogged openings and cleaning debris from the harvester's components
Changing oil filters and other maintenance tasks during extended harvest periods
Ensuring proper grain flow and quality by collecting samples for analysis

tasks.task: Maintaining open area fertility on a wheat farm
subtasks: Collecting soil samples to assess nutrient levels
Applying fertilizer based on soil test results and crop needs
Monitoring crop growth and health regularly to determine further fertilizer requirements

tasks.task: Harvesting wheat using a combine harvester
subtasks: Driving the combine into position at the beginning of the harvest row
Ensuring the combine is set up correctly for wheat stubble height
Operating the combine's settings for optimal grain pickup and cleaning
Adjusting the combine's mechanisms to clean the grain and separate straw efficiently
Monitoring the grain moisture levels and regulating the combine fan or drying system if necessary

tasks.task: Loading and unloading grain from the combine
subtasks: Connecting the combine's grain tank to a grain truck or bin when full
Lowering the combine's auger or tailgate to unload grain into truck or bin
Ensuring grain bin systems are properly connected and secure
Cleaning the combine's auger or transfer lines after unloading each bin

tasks.task: Performing mid-harvest maintenance on a combine harvester
subtasks: Checking fluid levels (oil, hydraulic, fuel) and topping up as needed
Replacing bands or any worn parts on the combine's wheels
Monitoring vibration or unusual noises and addressing issues promptly

tasks.task: Tilling wheat stubble for the following crop
subtasks: Determining the appropriate tillage method (chisel plow, disk, etc.) based on soil conditions
Preparing the field by plowing or disking the wheat stubble
Ensuring proper depth and disturbance of the soil to incorporate any remaining crop residue

tasks.task: Applying herbicides to wheat fields
subtasks: Calibrating herbicide application equipment or the combine's sprayer
Spraying the wheat fields to control weeds, adjusting for herbicide drift and application rates
Monitoring weather conditions to avoid spraying during windy or wet periods

tasks.task: Calculating and recording combine harvest data
subtasks: Keeping track of acres harvested, grain yield, and time spent on each section
Inputting data into a record-keeping system or farm management software
Analyzing yield maps and field performance to identify areas of the field that may require adjustments

tasks.task: Ensuring combine safety during operation
subtasks: Conducting daily safety checks on the combine before starting
Wearing appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE) during operation
Ensuring proper signaling when moving the combine on roads or complex field terrain

tasks.task: Managing combine air filtration systems
subtasks: Inspecting the filter for dirt and debris at regular intervals
Cleaning or replacing air filters as necessary to ensure optimal engine performance
Monitoring pressure gauges or indicators related to air filtration systems

tasks.task: Ensuring proper nozzle settings for combining operation
subtasks: Adjusting the combine's threshing-btnach door, concave clearance, and other settings based on grain type and moisture
Making sure that grain losses are minimal during harvest by fine-tuning operating parameters

tasks.task: Using precision agriculture tools during combine operation
subtasks: Activating GPS guidance systems to maintain straight rows and efficient harvesting
Utilizing yield monitors to collect real-time data on grain output

tasks.task: Observing health and stovness of wheat crop during combine operation
subtasks: Noticing signs of stress or disease in the crop while harvesting
Documenting any issues or zones needing follow-up management

tasks.task: Controlling straw when harvesting wheat
subtasks: Ensuring that the combine's straw chopper is set to the correct throwing angle and speed
Checking the cut straw for even distribution and adjusting as necessary

tasks.task: Conducting seedbed preparation for the following wheat crop
subtasks: Applying lime or other soil amendments as needed based on soil tests
Seeding the field with cover crops or a winter wheat crop
Ensuring soil tilth is appropriate for planting via further tillage if necessary

tasks.task: Directing combine operator during wheat harvest
subtasks: Communicating with the combine operator about field progress and specific tasks
Ensuring the combine adheres to operational guidelines and safety protocols

tasks.task: Preparing grain for storage after combine harvest
subtasks: Checking the grain for proper moisture content and temperature before storage
Cleaning the grain to remove debris and foreign materials
Properly ventilating grain storage bins to prevent spoilage

tasks.task: Operating a differential GPS receiver on a combine
subtasks: Initializing the differential GPS signal for accurate mapping and guidance
Checking system connectivity and signal strength during field operations

tasks.task: Conducting combine roll test checks after a harvest day
subtasks: Inspecting the combine's tires for damage or excessive wear
Checking braking systems and ensuring the clutch is functioning properly

tasks.task: Responding to combine maintenance issues during harvest
subtasks: Diagnosing and resolving engine problems if the combine stalls or malfunctions
Checking hydraulic systems for leaks or component failures

tasks.task: Operating a meter throw for grain flow adjustments
subtasks: Tilting the meter throw mechanism to regulate grain delivery into the combine’s grain tank

tasks.task: Practicing safe grain handling when unloading from combine
subtasks: Ensuring personnel are clear of auger or tailgate areas when unloading
Properly securing grain bins or trucks to prevent accidents during loading/unloading

tasks.task: Adjusting combine hydraulic settings for different soil types
subtasks: Changing binding roll height or cross stabilizer settings based on field conditions

tasks.task: Assisting with combine harvest by cleaning grain bins
subtasks: Climb grain bins to access augers or bin top cleaning systems
Clearing blockages in grain unloading systems

tasks.task: Monitoring combine oil temperature and pressure during operation
subtasks: Checking the oil temperature gauge periodically and comparing to normal ranges
Adjusting combine settings if excessively high temperatures are detected

tasks.task: Conducting combine hydrostatic transmission checks
subtasks: Inspecting the transmission fluid for contamination or leakage
Adjusting transmission fluid levels and pressures as necessary

tasks.task: Evaluating combine performance using yield monitors
subtasks: Reviewing yield data from the monitor to assess efficiency and identify problem areas
Comparing yield maps with historical data to plan for future harvests

tasks.task: Operating a combine's seeder attachment for drilling wheat
subtasks: Activating the seeder drum and proper linkage settings for direct seeding
Ensuring the seeder's fertilization and chemical application systems are set correctly

tasks.task: Applying glysophate to wheat fields prior to harvest
subtasks: Mixing and measuring out the correct concentration of glysophate
Applying the herbicide via spray rig attached to the combine
Ensure proper overlap and coverage to prevent bare spots or overapplication

tasks.task: Performing regular check of combine's beater bar for mud and adherant crops
subtasks: Inspecting the beater bar’s paddles for proper rotation and clean operation
Clearing any adherent crops or foreign materials from the beater bars

tasks.task: Ensuring combine's air washers are clean and functioning
subtasks: Checking air washers for blockages due to chaff, dirt, etc.
Cleaning or replacing air washers as needed to maintain air flow quality

tasks.task: Following machine條ine guidelines when moving the combine through fields
subtasks: Navigating the combine through corners or tight areas safely without damaging crops
Using safety cones or flags to alert other farmers or equipment operators

tasks.task: Using a GPS auto-steer system on the combine
subtasks: Acquiring high-precision positioning data via satellites
Adjusting the steering interface to follow GPS-guided routes through the field

tasks.task: Conducting Stover sampling on wheat stalks
subtasks: Collecting samples of the wheat stover to assess its quality for livestock feed or biofuel
Analyzing the samples to determine nutrient content or fiber levels

tasks.task: Performing daily operator training checks
subtasks: Starting the combine and verifying that all controls and instruments are responsive
Verifying proper seatbelts and restraints are in place before operation
Connecting the combine to a grain wagon or trailer other than a bin

tasks.task: Diagnosing and repairing combine core sampling system malfunctions
subtasks: Troubleshooting issues with the sample chutes or air systems
Disassembling and cleaning sampling components as needed

tasks.task: Operating a gps survey system on the combine
subtasks: Activating the GPS survey software and setting up coordinate reference systems
Collecting field data for mapping or measurement purposes using the combine

tasks.task: Maintaining accurate records of combine fuel consumption
subtasks: Monitoring fuel gauge intermittently to track how much fuel has been used
Recording fuel usage in relation to the amount of grain harvested

tasks.task: Verifying that the combine is operating within noise compliance standards
subtasks: Checking the decibel level of the combine's exhaust and engine during operation
Ensuring any excess noise is addressed to comply with local regulations

tasks.task: Implementing a delayed cut strategy for certain wheat areas
subtasks: Changing the combine’s depth control settings to leave a higher crop stubble
Noting the immediate impact on subsequent crop growth and soil moisture

tasks.task: Performing reverse tillage operations after combine harvest
subtasks: Determining the need for deep ripping or other reverse tillage practices
Conducting such operations to prevent compaction or improve seedbed conditions
Driving the combine from the first field to the next, checking for road and traffic conditions

tasks.task: Performing combine's hydraulic feed force adjustment based on ground conditions
subtasks: Adjusting the hydraulic feed force (pushing power) to optimize performance over varying terrain

tasks.task: Determining the need for fumigation after combine harvest
subtasks: Examining the field for signs of residual pests or diseases requiring fumigation
Planning the fumigation schedule and necessary treatment areas if needed

tasks.task: Implementing boundary tie turns during combine operation
subtasks: Using the combine’s auto-guidance system to make precise turns at field edges
Confirming that the system properly sets the boundary to exclude crop sprayed fields

tasks.task: Using combine's external sprayer during harvest
subtasks: Activating the external sprayer to apply crop protection products while moving through the field
Ensuring correct product flow rates and coverage

tasks.task: Checking on combine's hydraulic drive system components
subtasks: Inspecting pump and motor sections for any damage or fluid leaks
Verify that hoses and couplings are secure and undamaged

tasks.task: Using combine's onboard technology for crop mapping
subtasks: Loading field boundaries and points into GPS mapping system
Tracking progress and analyzing the map data during harvest

tasks.task: Applying nitrates based on combine-derived yield maps
subtasks: Preparing the application equipment or attach a spreader onto the combine
Applying variable rates of nitrogen to various areas of the field as indicated by yield maps

tasks.task: Performing spot checks on combine's cutting unit
subtasks: Checking the condition of the cutter bars or sickle blades
Adjusting tension or sharpening blades as needed to ensure proper crop pickup

tasks.task: Taking safety previsions to check for unexpected obstacles during combine operation
subtasks: Ensuring visibility around the combine by removing any crop stubble or blockages
Checking the field for downed trees or machinery parts before operating

tasks.task: Starting up pivot irrigation system after the combine harvest
subtasks: Initiating the irrigation system to water the field if needed for post-harvest crop recovery
Implementing variable travel speeds using the combine's programmed guidance for optimal moisture management
Stopping the combine periodically to brush or wash off contaminants to maintain performance
